intro: Oxymeris itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia oxymeris, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Brazilian Atlantic Forest. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with elliptical leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, spherical fruits. Oxymeris itatiaiae is known for its ecological significance in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
